yep it was pretty sketchy. the reason i know it was from info they sold was because it was spoofed as being the email account that I just setup on Zoho (xxxx@dogtoys.com).
The email it was spoofing literally didn't exist until the day I signed up on Zoho and wasn't common like admin/contact...anyway, I forwarded the original emails to support, but never got an official response. They did eventually stop after about a 3 weeks though so /shrug.

Yeah Zoho share/sell your email with some pretty shady businesses. I signed up for Zoho a while back and the same day I started receiving phishing emails alerting me to "changes on my site" which were word play variations on the site I submitted.
My site was dogtoys.com (not really) and i started getting emails saying "dogtoyz.com" files had been changed and I needed to login etc.
*crosses fingers*

This should be higher up. Everything mentioned so far varies so much in terms of intended users/site needs/required skill level etc.
This is like simply asking someone what's the best tool....

If your site suffers from an 8+ loading time, there's likely a lot more issues than just a bloated theme.
Having a really clean, efficiently coded theme isn't going to solve issues like bad hosts, poorly written plugins, etc.
And if your site is as minimal as you're trying to portray it as...it's almost certainly things other than the theme.
Even the most bloated top selling themes like Avada aren't so bad as to cause 6+ second load times by themselves.

Siteground shared hosting was extremely slow in my experience. I had the growbig plan and load times were 3.5+ seconds consistently for months with minimal traffic as the site was brand new.
Spent some time looking up info on Reddit, reading Digital Ocean tutorials, Googling, etc. and set up my own stack (1 gig VPS on Digital Ocean)...
Now the exact same site/theme loads under 1s consistently.
If you don't have the ability/desire to DIY (and I probably wouldn't with an ecommerce site), I'd look into a managed VPS (not Cloudways though). Sorry don't have anyone to recommend (other than skipping Cloudways) because after a very bad, brief experience with Cloudways i just decided to do it myself.
